website_summaries.verdict: Cover offers a nice look and fit, but it's not the most durable option if you're planning on exposing it long-term to sunlight.
pros: Fits boats 14- feet to 24-feet, as well as beams of 68- inches to 102- inches
Made from marine-grade 600- denier polyester canvas
Fits v-hull, tri-hull, and runabout boats
Ships with straps, quick-release buckles, and a storage bag
cons: This cover can leave stains on boat padding
Reports of this cover fading and getting brittle after a few months in the sun

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof ???....Not even close......GARBAGE !!!
customer_reviews.text: Looks absolutely amazing coming out of the package, and even better on the boat......but......this cover is a FAR, FAR cry from waterproof, and was absolutely soaked through after one night of fog......not even one drop of rain. There actually seemed to be more moisture ( literally dripping wet ) on the inside of the cover than the outside. This is in January / California so humidity obviously not the culprit. No puddling or pooling on the outside as there is multiple points of support.......I cant even honestly explain how disappointed I am in this product. Even my wife was mystified at how wet this was.....took it off and returning.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks better in the pic
customer_reviews.text: It's not as heavy duty as it looks on the pics. It is coated with the stuff cheap backpacks are coated with or water proofing that always peels off after a while. It priced right but is a disposable item after one or two years. So if your sensitive about buying quality items that are not made to fill land fills- stay away from this cover. If you don't care and want something you change out and throw away every couple years-this is for you.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Luke

customer_reviews.title: MSC Heavy Duty 600D Boat Cover
customer_reviews.text: Very Heavy duty 600D cover, much better than the old one and cost was very reasonable! Bought foam corner bumpers for babies and toddlers that protector the corners of tables from bumping their noggins and installed them on 3 sharp corners of the boat to keep the cover from ripping. You can find these on Amazon. This is a very nice cover and would recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: plinkerman

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 10 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Lasted 10 weeks and then it disintegrated. Would rip and fall apart with the slightest touch. The the Phoenix heat is tough on boat fiberglass and boat covers but this lastest the shortest time of any boat cover I have ever owned. Very disappointed !!!
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty good
customer_reviews.text: It did well after a thunderstorm last night, but It is a slight bit short and wouldn't go over the back. Maybe it just needs to stretch out, IDK, but it was fairly easy to put on by myself. Had to make adjustments as the straps didn't exactly reach down to the trailer the way the directions said to use them, so I tied them to the tarp and clipped them down on the trailer around the trailer beam. It works. Just wish it was a little longer. This is a 16' boat and I measured everything prior to ordering and ordered the one suggested in the description. Other than that, it's bright and works pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Todd H

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for...
customer_reviews.text: PROS: - Inexpensive. CONS: - My Pacific Blue color is starting to fade after 2 months of minimal sun exposure (Ohio). - There is no venting, so mold builds up rather quickly. It’s confusing because the mater seems to be somewhat permiable. To help with the mold, I recently purchased a couple Boat-Vent-3s. We’ll see how that works. CONCLUSION: - Boat covers are like hot tub covers- you get what you pay for. Whatever cost level you buy, expect to pay around 100 bucks a year. A good quality boat (or hot tub) cover is around $300+. I expect to have to replace this in a year.
customer_reviews.author: Davido

customer_reviews.title: Great, Cant complain. Seems to be thick material and it repels water as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I give the cover 5 Stars, but 4 stars goes to the size. I have a small 14 foot deep v fiberglass boat with a small windshield and it barely covers the front of the boat. The rest fits great, even covers part of my motor. It is definitely not made for boats with windshields. Mine is short, about one foot. Any larger and it would not fit at all. Overall fits better than the last one I had with the same measurements. Almost perfect fit it is. For an affordable cover, not custom I can not complain. Product deserves 5 stars. They company just needs to have more options for sizes for boats with windshields.
customer_reviews.author: Big Daddy

customer_reviews.title: great fit for my boat
customer_reviews.text: My boat cover had a tear in it so water leaked through when it rained. I didn't want to spend a lot buying another one of good quality so I looked on Amazon. This cover is great. Great quality material and fits good. Make sure to check your dimensions before ordering. Only issue is the fit does not seem tight enough when pulling the boat while driving. I had to pull over and take it off because it was blowing around enough that I was afraid it would blow off. So I only use it when storing or leaving the boat parked, otherwise take it off when moving it.
customer_reviews.author: JMG

customer_reviews.title: Fits my boat like a glove.  Looks great.
customer_reviews.text: So, I bought this cover for my 1977 Mercury Invader boat. Its 18 feet long. I think the color match is spot on. The fit is damn near perfect. Has all the straps to secure it. Everything seems to be of good quality. It fits my boat perfectly with the exception of where my ladder is and I am perfectly okay with that. I measured my beam width to make sure it was within the specs. I cannot be happier. Second night the boat was outside with the cover typical Oklahoma storm, plenty of rain, even knocked a few limbs onto the cover, it looks great and did its job.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Protect my boat as described
customer_reviews.text: So I moved into a condo, with no garage. Ordered up the cover for my Alumacraft Navigator CS 17 boat. Fits good enough, faded as expected with it always outside and uncovered now, and leaks a bit when I don't support it properly with PVC piping, causing water to pool on it. I don't know when it will begin to tear, but think it will last a couple of years, so overall a good value to me.
customer_reviews.author: kayaker

customer_reviews.title: Fits a 18’ deep-V ‘94 Four Winns well.
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed when we had had a big rain and we hadn’t been able to strap it down right because we had put on a tower (I have since modified the cover, as you can see). We had DEEP puddles in the bow and open area in the stern. My husband just knew we were going to have to bail water out of the boat, but not a drop cake through. Wh haven’t ( and won’t) tried trailering it down the highway, it fits well enough I might have tried it, prior to modifications, but it really wasn’t tight enough to make me feel good about it.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa B.

customer_reviews.title: GREAT boat cover!
customer_reviews.text: This cover is spectacular. It is everything that the posting claims it to be. I trailered my boat from Florida to New York with this cover and the boat was completely protected. No issues along with way and after the trip the cover is as good as new. In my opinion, you won't find a better cover for the money than this one.
customer_reviews.author: BC Cloutier

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it don't do it.
customer_reviews.text: Bought what I thought was a really good cover. Hasn't even been a year and this thing is faded to almost white. It leaks like crazy. And no where is there a button to contact the seller for warranty. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: kenneth glover

customer_reviews.title: Better than I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: Well. I bought this 2 yrs ago but just got it out of the box. I read the 1 star reviews and was a bit concerned. After i did and put it on i thought, ok there is no vents to trailer it. But frankly that would be short distances. So yes it probably is trailerable. Secondly many people commented on fabric quality. Face it, for 100$ yoyre not getting cordura, its nylon fabric and frankly im not sure i could go out and but 8yrds of 600d nylon fabric for 100$ so it a solid 3.5-4 🌟 product
customer_reviews.author: Joshua B

customer_reviews.title: Quality Cover That'll do the Job
customer_reviews.text: The cover is great for my needs - good price, quality and fit. I've got it on a 16' aluminum Lund. It's plenty big enough to overlap the sides with the seats in place and the backs up. The tie-downs are typical of this type of cover - not any better or worse than the many similar covers I've had. The fabric and workmanship seem to be better than many of the other covers I've had, so I'm happy with this cover. I'll recommend it to friends and would purchase another.
customer_reviews.author: COLDESU

customer_reviews.title: It looks and fits so nicely, so giving seller a second chance if Seller will comment.
customer_reviews.text: Received it Sept.19, 2020. Heavy material and happily installed it the same day. Pulled it tight, but no tighter then previous covers (including the cheaper one it replaces). It tore through a rounded transom corner of the boat. So disappointing. Now it becomes a tape job to waterproof or attempt it from tearing more in travel. Maybe a weaving lemon in manufacturing or previous damage in packaging??? So disappointing.Maybe a refurb?
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy C

customer_reviews.title: My cover experience..so far
customer_reviews.text: Ok so I just got my cover 3-4 weeks ago. Because of its price I was surprised it came with like 10 ratchet clamps. It fit great, looked good I was happy with it. But... It was blue, blue when I got it and its already faded a lot to a light blue. I do mean faded a lot. It rained the first week and it was waterproof, but don't know it if still it??? Id almost bet it doesn't make it all the way to summer 2020 but I hope so. It was a low cost so didn't expect a lot. But fading to almost a light grey so soon..... Humm I doubt
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Brown

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this and rec'd this on June 23, 2019. Within the first month holes and rips appeared. We were not rough with this product as we wanted it to last. Aug 8 my husband took it to the Upper Peninsula for the second time and the back area shredded and the elastic cord broke. Patching the holes did not work. We are saddened this product did not work well in the 2 1/2 Months we have owned it. It will not protect our boat for the rest of the year in this condition! Also it cost more than most listed. We feel a replacement would be appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Carol L.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: This cover appears to be made with care; the stitching is especially well done. The cover seems more water-proof than most I've seen. The straps and strap loops are well-made. The only down-side is that it takes a long time to unpack. The cover arrived in a vacuum-sealed bag. Once opened, it took about half an hour to get it to full size; imagine a giant ball of Saran-wrap. All-in-all, I'm glad I purchased this cover.
customer_reviews.author: Mathew E. Metcalfe

customer_reviews.title: Nice cover
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my Yamaha AR230, 23ft. The cover fits nicely over the top, and secures nicely to the trailer. It's a good quality material and should last a good three or four years before needing replacement. At this price, it sure beats paying $600 or more for the OEM cover! For those wondering if you can tow with the cover on, I wouldn't hesitate on short trips, 5 miles or less (ie. from the storage yard to your house), but definitely would not recommend at highway speeds or long distances.
customer_reviews.author: David B

customer_reviews.title: Update after 6 dos
customer_reviews.text: This cover for my boat has proved marginal for rain protection. Cover fit like you expect. But breathability was excessive allowing moisture to come into the underside of the cover dripping during rainfall increasing water vapor and wet surfaces, and mold. Seams had to be sealed at the beginning. Keeps leaves and dust out with secure straps. Best for garage kept boats out of the rain.
customer_reviews.author: beebop

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC!
customer_reviews.text: Just got it in a little bit ago. Covers the boat up great. I didn't have to remove the swivel seats, it even covers the motor very nicely. My boat is an 87 Astroglass 660. Was a super simple install, stretched over the seats, dash, trolling motor and everything really nice and tight! I'll have to shorten the straps, but that's no big deal at all! Since the boat is parked right next to our pool, and my grandson is in the pool, I got to see how water repellent it is right away! Beads right off! It's a real good investment to protect my investment!
customer_reviews.author: Easyricer

customer_reviews.title: No vents
customer_reviews.text: I have a 19' open bow Caravelle with and I/O and I bought the 22' cover. I like to cover the outdrive (propeller is still exposed), the crank for the winch, a little of the spare tire and a little bit more of the sides of the boat so I don't have to wax/polish and much or as vigorously throughout the season since I store it outside the whole time. I've had one similar to this for a few years and seemed to hold up well so I'll try it again. The last two I had were from Classic Accessories and only lasted 18-24months each. I hope this one holds up well but with it had a vent.
customer_reviews.author: Baummer

customer_reviews.title: 2' to short.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the 14' to 16' cover. It Came to me on time. Tried to put it on my 1986 16' closed bow boat and it wouldn't fit. I had my wife hold the cover over the front of the bow were the tag said (front) on the cover, pulled it over the windshield but I couldn't pull it over the back of the boat. Cover seemed to be 2' to short. I measured my boat again to make sure it was 16'.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality but fadeds!
customer_reviews.text: This fits great and has lots of straps and is definitely waterproof ! But it faded really quick. I got the darkest blue one and from the beginning of the summer to the end the part that’s on the outside has turned mostly purple which is really apparent when it is compared to the inside that doesn’t see the sun. But otherwise is thick and sturdy and easy to put on and take off and had clearly labeled tags for the front and the back and does it’s job.
customer_reviews.author: Meyer Family

customer_reviews.title: C+. Abundant width, tight length, leaky seams
customer_reviews.text: Covers my 17’6” boat with 86” beam fine, but while it’s stretched tight from now to stern, there is lots of extra fabric hanging over the sides. Lots of straps and anchors, but all the loose fabric hanging over means I would never drive anywhere with it flapping about. After two days of rain, the *fabric* repels water but the SEAMS leak. Overall, I give this cover a C+. It covers the boat completely but sloppily, won’t blow off in the wind if strapped down, but misses major points for leaky seams and floppy measurements.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Swift, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Covers Faded
customer_reviews.text: I've had 2 of these covers on 2 boats for 9 months now. They do a great job keeping water out. The fit of the covers is good for an after market product. Of course nothing can equal a custom made cover. My only issue is with the wearability. As you can see the covers have faded significantly over the winter. A time of year when there is generally much less sunlight due to shorter days. Now that the summer sun has arrived I fear it will be much worse. I'm wondering if this will effect the ability to repel water.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Haley

customer_reviews.title: Great Service, Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived just as described and well packaged. I had a minor issue with my first one, sent pictures to the company and with no hesitation they offered up a replacement. I have and will continue to recommend these covers to fellow boaters. Thank you Jackie and Summates! Fits my 94 ski Centurion Falcon 20'-6" covering the swim platform as well. (No Tower)
customer_reviews.author: Raymond

customer_reviews.title: Best cover I’ve ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had my boat for about 15 years now. It seems like I was buying a new cover once or twice a year. All of them leak, most of them tear within the first few months. Where I live we have several days over 100° so the UV rays really destroy most covers. I have to say this cover has lasted 15 months and the inside is still bone dry after a rainstorm. Finally, a cover that actually works and lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Love it so much I bought another for my other boat.
customer_reviews.text: What a great cover. Bought this one for my 14’ boat and used it while trailering on a 1000 mile round trip fishing excursion. Trailers awesome. I went ahead and promptly bought another one for my new-to-me 19’ boat. Love. Them. Both. Arrives vacuum-packed in a stuff sack with all the straps you’ll need and instructions even a dimwit like me can follow. Top quality and well-made. You can color me impressed to get this nice of a trailerable cover at such a good price. Five stars.
customer_reviews.author: DENTON

customer_reviews.title: Great Cover For the Money
customer_reviews.text: I've had my cover for almost a year and hear is what I like: Its light weight and easy to put on the boat. Straps and tie-downs are good quality and work well. Overall, it's done a nice job of protecting my boat. It's a good quality cover for the money. Here's what I don't like: The portion of the cover in the sun has faded significantly. The small strap that goes underneath the bow is detached. Great cover for the money!
customer_reviews.author: Rogerball

customer_reviews.title: Solid investment
customer_reviews.text: I had the original cover that came with the boat and it has deteriorated over time. I took a chance on this one and what a huge difference. Because I didn't put a support in the middle, after a good rain, there was a small pond on the cover. Once I scooped the water out, I was expecting a wet boat. Not even a little bit. Boat was bone dry which was surprising considering the amount of water it was holding. Straps are great and easy to attach or remove.
customer_reviews.author: T. Turner Sr

customer_reviews.title: and threw this one in the garbage. It didn't last 3 months
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this cover in late April, put it on our boat. The cover didn't fit our runabout, but for the money it protected our seats and interior. We took the cover off for the first time in July and it tore. It was so faded out, and fabric was brittle. Ended up purchasing another cover, and threw this one in the garbage. It didn't last 3 months. It didn't cost very much, and that I guess should have been our warning. Very disappointing for this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda L Almquist

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Seems pretty good. It is actually a little heavier duty than I thought it would be for the price. I would say this is a light duty cover that will be very nice if under a covered parking that keeps most of the sun and all off. Like a grill cover material. Fits great. Overall I am very pleased. I will update after summer and see how it held up to the elements.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle's Uncle

customer_reviews.title: Great protection from sun and water
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 18’ Rinker inboard/outboard. Shipped right on time and was nicely packaged with a cinch storage bag included. Fit was perfect for our boat! Quality appears to be substantial. It did rain the first night installed and water pooled which isn’t so good for the stitching so we would highly recommend the support poles to prevent the water weighing down the cover. Overall, it’s a great cover at an affordable price!
customer_reviews.author: donna baker :)

customer_reviews.title: does not fit try hull
customer_reviews.text: My boat is 14 ft with beam of 63 inches. The description says it fits trim hull 14 to 16 ft with beam up 68 inches but is much too small. The cover itself is beautiful but I wish not fit like it says .
customer_reviews.author: David K

customer_reviews.title: Puddles
customer_reviews.text: The cover looks like it is of good quality, but after some average rainfall last night. I uncovered the boat today and found water pooled inside the boat. Not good and this was with a support pole in the middle to prevent pooling on the cover itself, yet it still managed to get in the boat. For that I would not recommend this cover. The buckling system sucks as well. They should have the buckles sewn into the cover
customer_reviews.author: N. Modonas

customer_reviews.title: nice cover
customer_reviews.text: nice bright color faded some after a year and water resistance is almost zero now but still great cover strong material no rips or tears after a year have had snow rain sun water etc I will spray it with water repellent and hope fully get another year out of it would not tow with it on storage only straps break easy
customer_reviews.author: robert rench

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, not waterproof where touching surfaces.
customer_reviews.text: Not waterproof as advertised, at least not where it touches a surface. Put new carpet in a hull I'm restoring and bought this to keep the incoming rain out before the glue dried. Covered the main cabin with plywood to keep the cover supported and not create pooling which worked until I noticed the next day after the rain that any portion of the cover that was touching a surface had allowed water to permeate through. Carpet was soaked and bildge was full of water. Bummer. Will try to change to support poles and see if the water doesnt permeate through. Quality of stitching, fit and elastic are great otherwise. Will update after long term use.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Stefaniak

customer_reviews.title: This cover proved to be totally waterproof even during the worst rain & wind storms
customer_reviews.text: I have a Nitro Z18 and I purchased this cover to protect my $700 cover during the summer when I store it outside. This cover proved to be totally waterproof even during the worst rain & wind storms. It also has plenty of tie-downs which keeps the cover completely secured. I have to say that this item, for any price, is one of the best purchases I have made in the last 5 years!!
customer_reviews.author: Dan Xpress

customer_reviews.title: better than anticipated
customer_reviews.text: Looks and performs better than anticipated. For the budget priced cover, I was expecting a flimsy ill fitting cover, but was pleasantly surprised when cover fit snugly and tied down tightly and securely. Cover has a slight low area at the rear of the boat, in front off the engine, but inserting a five gallon bucket under the cover at this location took out all the slack, and positioned the cover to easily shed water completely.
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: We think it's a good value.
customer_reviews.text: We will still need to see how it holds up after the snow & cold this winter, but overall, we're happy with it. It doesn't fit as snug & pretty as in the picture, but that shouldn't matter. Hopefully, it will protect our investment through the weather. We also intend to keep snow & water from too much accumulation so that it won't tear in the area where it sags.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly S

customer_reviews.title: Not water resistant at all.
customer_reviews.text: Loved this initially. I Was pleased with the fit. It was exactly what I expected for a one size fits all type of measurement. But I was very very disappointed in was the first time it rained! I absolutely could not believe how much water got through onto the floor of our boat!!
customer_reviews.author: Emanderson

customer_reviews.title: Stained our boat!!
customer_reviews.text: I was happy with my purchase until today. I bought this boat cover about 2 weeks ago. It has rained a few times and I thought it was holding up but removed it today and the material left some sort of blue adhesive that eventually came off after scrubbing but it stained our boat. I am extremely upset. I spent $100 assuming I was getting quality but now after just 2 weeks of use I can no longer put this on the boat and will have to find some way to hopefully get the stains removed. Very poor quality!
customer_reviews.author: Ixarelis Rosario

customer_reviews.title: Decent cover for price.
customer_reviews.text: Description said waterproof. That is not the case. Now it is water resistant. Mild rain brought water in through all seams. For the money definitely expected I guess. Fit 21ft pro craft perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Pugh

customer_reviews.title: Only time will tell
customer_reviews.text: appears to be good product, but last cover i purchased (different product) around same price range was great at the beginning. Within 2 years the last cover was literally falling apart. Replaced it with this one. Figured i would mention it now since i will not be able to comment in 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: Diego Cantu

customer_reviews.title: Great boat cover for the winter !
customer_reviews.text: Other than the fact that it's a bit short (described at fitting up to 24' and it barely wraps to the back of my boat), great product. Extremely strong, durable, once tightened properly the water just rolls off it. You have to adjust it correctly and position a few poles to make sure you don't create a "sag", but once you have it on properly it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Danieli

customer_reviews.title: Not for outdoor use
customer_reviews.text: This boat cover was fine at first. It fit nicely. However a little over a year of this cover sitting outside on the boat, it started to tear at the bow. No apparent reason other than the material obviously does not stand up to Arizona sun. When I contacted the company and sent pictures, more than a month later they told me that it happened because the straps were too tight. Well that is not correct. This material does not appear to be weather resistant. They won't stand by the 2 year warranty and instead offered to credit me $20. We'll see if that actually happens. That should be enough to buy a tarp that will probably last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Walker

customer_reviews.title: cheap chinese crap
customer_reviews.text: Sorry to say but this cover does not keep water out. The day I put this on my boat we had a lot of rain and it leaked pretty bad. This is the usual cheap chinese crap, spend a few extra bux and buy one that is 100% waterproof the other issue is it cost me $22 dollars to ship it back, A total waste of time and money..
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Color fades quickly
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this boat cover for a week or so. It is very susceptible to UV. In the short time I have had it, the tan color has faded a lot. So, expect this cover to look very old very quickly. I cannot speak to its long term durability yet, but for now it seems to be keeping the rain out.
customer_reviews.author: Moffitt

customer_reviews.title: good cover
customer_reviews.text: runs small, better to go big. pretty durable despite a lot of me not taking good care of it. also has retained its water proofing far longer than i would have thought. i'd buy it again. keep in mind you're going to need a way to get water off it. either tent poles or air bags to keep water from pooling and dragging it down or holes cut in low points where water collects leading to a connection piece/drain pipe that someone sells. i forget what its called but its out there
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality and well constructed.
customer_reviews.text: This boat cover is the best I've ever bought online. So good I purchased an extra. Very good quality cover and well constructed. I highly recommend this product. I have bought several boat covers over the years and have always been disappointed...not this time! Excellent choice!
customer_reviews.author: Earl

customer_reviews.title: Nice but has flaws
customer_reviews.text: This cover looks great... however... it is not very waterproof. Snow melted and this cover seeped into my boat quite a bit. I added a normal tarp to help keep water out... if your just looking for a cover to keep debris out then this is perfect... as far as winterizing goes I would not suggest this as a fool proof cover.
customer_reviews.author: Trashiscash

customer_reviews.title: So far so good... Great cover!
customer_reviews.text: Had this cover for one year so far, it has faded but still completely intact. No tears or holes. It is water 'resistant', it will hold most of the water on top of the cover but some will seep through. It is easier than the factory cover and can be done by one fairly mobile person. Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Timmah78

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the price.
customer_reviews.text: The boat cover appears to be well made, good quality stitching. The straps and clips are good quality. Overall fit is satisfactory considering the numerous styles of boats on the market these covers are intended to fit. I would recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Good item but wrong color
customer_reviews.text: The product itself seems fine it has a good quality feel and seems to do the job and fits well Don't know its resistancy to the elements yet but we'll see Unfortunately they sent me the wrong color I ordered the lightest color for the sun won't bake it and they sent me dark green
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Did not last one trip when trailered without tearing apart
customer_reviews.text: The cover looked nice but was thin material and the picture is what it looked like after trailering it one time to a friends house. I’m not happy to say the least and plan to try to get the company to honor the warranty on it by replacing it
customer_reviews.author: Robert Sutton

customer_reviews.title: Just Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This cover just fits perfect and the boat is kept under cover on a boat lift in the dock. This cover keeps the birds and other critters from soiling the boat. Great cover and with heavy rains going sideways, this cover keeps the boat dry!
customer_reviews.author: Hank

customer_reviews.title: Size up
customer_reviews.text: Material is satisfactory. Water durability seems proficient but has not been tested here in Michigan yet. Photo represents first install. I ordered one size larger for my 20' bowrider. Combined with customized pvc pipe and a tennis ball as poles to deflect water. One size up works perfect for my application. Exact size cover will probably suffice if your deflection pole doesnt have this extreme of a pitch. Straps are generic without Male nor felame end attached to the cover. Both male and female ends are part of a single strap.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Nice Cover
customer_reviews.text: My old custom cover got old and started to tear. Didn't really want to spend the money to get another custom cover. Bought this to pull the boat behind my camper for about 1000 miles. The cover fit great, it had plenty of strap to tie it to the frame and didn't have any issues. It seemed more durable than I expected. The canvas seems to be heavy duty and it has a liner underneath. Very impressed with the quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Brewton

customer_reviews.title: Thanks. Destroyed my vinyl.
customer_reviews.text: Horrible. In partial shade, lost almost all color in not even a year. Wait... Correction... it didn’t LOSE the color... the dye ended up DESTROYING my vinyl. Perfectly good seats that lasted nearly 20 years. Completely ruined. Tried everything to get the dye out. Next I’ll have to take to a vinyl shop. Maybe the manufacturer would like to pay the bill for the damage their cover caused. Three simple words. Do. Not. Buy. (Unless you buy the same color as your interior of boat, so when all the dye washes through, maybe it won’t be as obvious.)
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this boat cover for my 21' Maxum in July 2018. It is water resistent, but sun faded within weeks. We brought our boat home yesterday after having it stored for two months. It was cleaned (and completely dry) before we covered it and was not exposed to elements or moisture during storage. The inside of the cover had an incredibly thick layer of mold. We didn't even attempt to clean it and transferred it directly to the garbage. I'm incredibly disappointed with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Sami Jo

customer_reviews.title: It's okay for the price, don't expect waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Competent product, esp. for the price...if you have a fishing boat you don't mind getting a little wet. Ad copy says waterproof. It is not. Anywhere the fabric is touching the boat...water will wick through. One must fully suspend the entire cover off the boat (except the rails) to keep water out. To me, that is a test, with poles, supports, etc, which is not what I wanted. Your mileage may vary. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: held up well so far, good quality
customer_reviews.text: this fits my boat well and the quality is good. material is just the right weight and the fit is adjustable and i feel true to size. i have a 17.5' sea ray bowlder and its a little big, but that was expected. the tie down straps work well to make it fit tight when it rains.
customer_reviews.author: max

customer_reviews.title: Quite satisfied with this cover!👍
customer_reviews.text: Nice heavy duty cover. Description included “Tri-hull but front was too narrow! More like for a V-Hull but did barely fit. We’ll se how it holds up bin AZ sun and wind!- Survived a 200 mile trip with cover in place. Used extra tie downs. Need two more. Update: Just purchased another cover! The first one lasted 3 years in the AZ sun! I think that’s pretty good considering our weather. The nylon straps sun-rotted after a year so manufacturer may consider a different material for the straps.
customer_reviews.author: P. Venturacci Book Worm

customer_reviews.title: Really nice cover, easy to put on my 17' center ...
customer_reviews.text: Really nice cover, easy to put on my 17' center console. I bought a 18' to 19' so I can cover my motor too and it covers my 90hp yamaha. It repeal water nicely. The only thing is that it can accumulate a little bit of water but it is not a big deal, it dry up quickly... and for that price you can't beat this cover.....
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin ferrufino

customer_reviews.title: Choose neutral colors
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the Model C Pacific Blue last fall to keep leaves and dirt out. It fit my 17' stern drive boat fairly well, with just enough extra material to accommodate my home-made PVC prop skeleton. I like the strap connections, which made it easy to tie down, no need for bungee cords. The material seems sturdy, and so far has kept the rain out. Unfortunately, the blue color has faded badly.
customer_reviews.author: kyrie eleison

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: I was suprised with thr quality and fit of this cover I go through covers about ever 5 years and I have never got one this nice for so little money. Even if I only get 2 or 3 years it will still be worth it ...a littel advice dont tow your boat with this cover or any cover unless its a real exspensive custom one .the wind will destroy it
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Not heavy duty - you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This is a case of you get what you pay for. It is not "heavy duty" since we had it on the boat only a few times before a small rip. Then another small rip and another. It is currently shredded. I think it would work well if it was put on a boat in mild weather climate, and just left on. It doesn't work well if you are taking it on and off. And it seems to rip easier if the weather is warm and the cover gets hot.
customer_reviews.author: TLH

customer_reviews.title: This cover only lasted 6 months
customer_reviews.text: This cover is very water proof, until it ripped. It faded badly with in three months, and now has three rips with in 6 months. Exposed to south Florida sun thru the winter months of Nov -April. Now it is basicly sun damaged and fragile to handle. It's thickness and weight is mainly the plastic backing, and once the plastic dries out the top cloth is to thin to hold it together. It is advertised on amazon as having a 2 year warrenty, but cannot get it warrented after 6 months. I have had several different manufacture covers over the years in the Florida sun, most last 2 years . I would not recommend this cover.
customer_reviews.author: EA

customer_reviews.title: So far so good, easy to take on and off.
customer_reviews.text: This product works great so far (about 2 months). I really like how easy it is to put on and take off the boat. much easier than snaps. The durability seems good so far, for the price I am only hoping to get 2 years out of it. We will see how it holds up to the snow this winter. if it fales I will update this review.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: wanted to see how it holds up to weather
customer_reviews.text: So this cover does awesome in the weather! We had the largest snow storm in Oregon in a long time this year with of coarse a lot of rain. The only modification that I recommend is to use some wood slats to help support the cover. Also like anything else is have the front end raised up so the water can run off. this is on a tracker boat
customer_reviews.author: D. Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Great cover.
customer_reviews.text: Very good material. Wish there was an option for outboard motors available for this. Mine gets bunched up there and collects a pool of rain water. Also I'm using empty storage bins inside the boat as a way to prevent puddles there. Other ideas welcome.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: BEST BUY
customer_reviews.text: GREAT COVER BEST BUY! I PURCHASED A CUSTOM COVER FOR THE BOAT 3 YEARS AGO AND IT RIPPED IN 6 MONTHS. TOP OF THE LINE AND IT WAS TO SHORT. I TOWED THIS COVER FOR 800 MILES AND IT WAS PERFECT. JUST ORDER A LITTLE BIT BIGGER COVER SO YOU HAVE ROOM TO MAKE ADJUSTMENTS. I ADDED A FEW EXTRA TIE POINTS AND THAT DID THE JOB.
customer_reviews.author: JEFFREY MONROE

customer_reviews.title: Defective product with no prepaid return.
customer_reviews.text: Female clips were not sewn on the cover as specified rendering the securing of the cover impossible. Returning to shipper was not prepaid. Now I have to pay shipping for defective product. Buyer beware. Tie down straps are worthless. I’m going to buy some ropes!
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you measure
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my 86 four Winn’s freedom. Very good quality cover but the sizing just didn’t fit using there chart. You need to account for the pitch of your windscreen (they say not to)the higher it is it will affect your beam measurements and bow to stern. I needed to go one size up. Had to return this one waiting in my new one. I gave it 5 stars because it is a nice cover
customer_reviews.author: Muzickman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy
customer_reviews.text: Most durable nice boat cover ever. You won’t be disappointed. The seller is very understandable because we never ordered right size and we were way over our return window! Best seller and a super good product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Satisfactory replacement storage cover.
customer_reviews.text: It doesn’t have reinforcement in place for Putting up poles to divert the water off the canvas, and I’m afraid it’s going to tear. It rained quick and hard, very waterproof, but it did fill with water. And please note, it attaches to the trailer, so if you moor your boat on the water this cover will not work.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Hearn

customer_reviews.title: Good for storage, do not tow with it on.
customer_reviews.text: Strap failed and holes formed on the top of the cover after the first time driving with the cover on. Air gets pushed right into the elastic band between straps which essentially makes the cover not for trailering but for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Fearless

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this for about 2 months but it is a very rugged cover. It has multiple tie-downs, fits my 15 foot runabout perfectly and has proven to be completely waterproof. At the price, if it lasts 2 years it will be a bargain.
customer_reviews.author: William Wenzel

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS!
customer_reviews.text: Turned my boat green! I live in the PNW, so it rains. I generally keep my boat under a carport, but I took it to the shop for some seasonal work. While there, it rained. Thankfully I had my new cover on... or maybe thankfully is the wrong word. I got the boat home and took the cover off to check some things and I find that the color leaked all over my leather upholstery, staining it splotchy green. I couldn't be more furious! Do not buy this item unless you want to change the color of your boat.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Westra

customer_reviews.title: Stanied the boat seats
customer_reviews.text: We read all the reviews on this product and decided to purchase it. We were excited to receive ot to keep our boat covered from debris only to find out our back seats have been stained by the cover material and the heat outside. We are besides ourself since now we have to get the back seats recovered? I am so upset.
customer_reviews.author: Marla Maloon

customer_reviews.title: Works for price
customer_reviews.text: First one tore last week. Lasted about 1 1/2 years. Made it through Florence and NC pm sunshine for the time though. The higher grade covers double in price, but may be worth it for you, as I found this one prone to molding.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: It's a life changer
customer_reviews.text: I used the tarps from Walmart you two years and it was heck. I purchased this tarp and not a drop of water gets in. The boat is so dry now the mold died. I'm using this on my 24 ft Sea-Doo boat with a tower and it works great trailering it too. I can get the boat into the water fast now. No more cleaning pollen mold and dust.
customer_reviews.author: DELONNE

customer_reviews.title: good looking cover
customer_reviews.text: Decent quality, fits my 16 ft aluminum skiff reasonable well but needs a frame to hold it up in the middle or it turns into a slimy pond. It's a little too wide for my little boat but I knew that when I bought it so no complaints. They are very generous with the nylon tie down straps. It has been on my boat since last Fall and is holding up fine.
customer_reviews.author: James Knowles

customer_reviews.title: Great boat cover!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to replace a more expensive custom boat cover for our Bay liner that ripped on the front seam. This one is not as snug fit or as heavy, but I do believe it is even more water resistance. We don't travel with it, but I think if you strapped it down tight, it would be okay. Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: PinkLady

customer_reviews.title: Excellent well made tough
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I bought because a tree branch fell on boat and tore the original. I suggest following the advice in the product to use a support pole with this cover to channel water off your boat.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Davis

customer_reviews.title: Good cover for what I’m using it on.
customer_reviews.text: For what I bought it for it’s perfect considering the price I paid. I have an older boat and was just covering it up to prevent leaves etc. If you have a new boat don’t be cheap get a more expensive one. You will be much happier. As for me I’m satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel G.

customer_reviews.title: Faded quickly
customer_reviews.text: We received this product on 7/24/19 yesterday 8/26/19 We noticed that the fabric has already faded very bad. It has been raining A lot here and it did keep most of the water out of the boat However the fabric seems to have stretched out some and there was a contained lake in the back of our boat so I just bailed it out with a bucket. Overall we are very disappointed with our purchase unfortunately our return window closed 4 days ago, So we will have to make it work.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Leoni

customer_reviews.title: we are storing inside, but this looks to be better quality than others we have had in the past
customer_reviews.text: We are storing inside and not roading the boat with the cover, however I believe if or when we need a travel cover this will work fine. The quality looks better than many others we have traveled with over the 15 plus years with this boat Happy days on the water to you all
customer_reviews.author: pogchop

customer_reviews.title: Great cover excellent price
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy duty and seems like it will last. I have this on my 16/72 gator trax duck boat. It is model C. My boat is 80" wide at the back. Fits well and is a little long for me which is perfect to cover the trailer winch. I'm thinking if I turn it backwards it would likely cover motor too but I have a motor cover on the way. Came with more than enough buckles to keep it tight and I actually had 4 left over. 100% waterproof. Had a terrible storm days after installing. After checking the inside of boat was bone dry. Quality cover at a very affordable price!
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Boat cover fair priced, no straps included
customer_reviews.text: Great cover for my 17ft single console fishing boat. I use a secondary troll motor that mounts near the peak of the boat. This cover gives enough height near the peak to keep everything covered. This cover tightens down nice. CON: My only complaint is that it did not come with straps. Loops are nice and strong stitched. I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: UPCguy

customer_reviews.title: Fits 24ft cuddy cabin
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. I used it on the biggest boat it allowed. Being my boat is a cuddy cabin I needed to purchase a few extra tie downs for some areas to reach. Pack of 6 was only $10
customer_reviews.author: Harold H.

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking cover that unfortunately doesn't hold up!
customer_reviews.text: Product looked and felt great, for 6 months, but in the Florida sun this just didn't hold up! I'm at just under a year and the cover is literally disintegrating, if I pull it tight then it either tears or pulls off the tab... Leaves a powder residue on the boat and in general looks 100 years old. Not cool...
customer_reviews.author: Di Shropshire

customer_reviews.title: held up great in a big downpour.
customer_reviews.text: seems to be holding up well with the support system that i bought to help water to keep from pooling up. we will see how long it lasts. I will not be trailering with this cover although it seems you could if you simply padded high stress or sharp areas
customer_reviews.author: Durbijd

customer_reviews.title: Great cover! Last a long time
customer_reviews.text: We have bought two of these and they are really nice. They fit well and are made really well. They will fade in sun after a year or two. But we love it and it works great on a lot of different kinds of boats! Will buy again when needed
customer_reviews.author: Brooke Butler

customer_reviews.title: It will not fit a Tri-hull boat ....  It is designed for a v-hull  dont be fooled like me.
customer_reviews.text: Poor strap design and placement ... Fails to securely keep wind out when towing . When parked it needs a dozen bungees to keep it tight so water doesnt puddle in the open bow. I have 4 cover supports poles in the boat and it still sags and puddles water. Clearly a cheaply designed product. This is only the first season so I cant comment on its durability to sun or the quality of the product. Unless something is corrected with this order, I will not promote the vendor or the products they sell.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Bye

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice cover for the price range. I bought this as a replacement cover for my 14' v hull Jon boat. This one has elastic that pulls the edge closed much better than my old one. The straps are well located and keep the cover snug. Only time will tell about durability. So far, I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Owen

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: You get what you paid for. Worked great for one season. Must have the center poles to keep from water collecting. I bought some and it helped. Keeps water somewhat out I had a pole fall and water pooled. Did come through but not that bad. After a year I had a little water pool and the cover separated from one of the straps.
customer_reviews.author: adam lupinski

customer_reviews.title: Boat Cover bled through to our white boat
customer_reviews.text: We love the boat cover, but sadly after taking off to go to lake, we noticed streaks of the blue dye on our white boat. We have tried cleaning with many different cleaners to no avail. Wonder if you have a solution to this problem. I've spoken to another boater from this same place and it happened to them as well. How or what can be done about this? Please email me at dpodell5864@gmail.com. My name is Paula O'Dell. Thankyou for your help in this matter.
customer_reviews.author: Paula

product_meta.title: MSC Heavy Duty 600D Marine Grade Polyester Canvas Trailerable Waterproof Boat Cover,Fits V-Hull,Tri-Hull, Runabout Boat Cover
feature_bullets: Made of marine grade polyester canvas with double PU Coating
Designed for both long-term storage, mooring and highway travel
Includes adjustable straps and storage bag; 2 Year limited warranty
Recommend use boat cover support pole system
Model B - Length:14'-16' Beam width: up to 90"

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
